column2: to  be  accepted."  This  judgment  was  cited  with  approval
column3: in  Bobby  Mathew  V.  State  of

column1: Karnataka, 2004 Cr. IJ 3003. Applying the principles laid down in the  above judicial decision.  I may

column2: express  the  following  view.  Failure  to  suggest  the  defence  of alibi  to  the  prosecution  witnesses,
who implicated the accused, indicates that it was  a false  one.  Considering all  these matters I am  of
the opinion that the defence of alibi raised by the  3rd  accused appellant is an afterthought.
